title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and begins his magical education at Hogwarts.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected journey to help dwarves reclaim their homeland.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about surveillance, control, and totalitarian government.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story about justice and racial inequality in the American South.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrayal of wealth, love, and the American dream in the 1920s.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A mystery thriller involving secret societies and hidden religious history.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about following dreams and destiny.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones using small changes.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A brief history of humankind exploring culture, science, and civilization.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A science fiction epic about politics, religion, and survival on a desert planet.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel exploring teenage alienation and identity.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who stops speaking after committing murder.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about growing up in a strict household and pursuing education.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A horror novel about isolation and supernatural forces in a haunted hotel.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut stranded on Mars struggles to survive using science and ingenuity.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Explores how humans make decisions and the psychology behind thinking.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: A guide for entrepreneurs on building startups using iterative product development.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: A biography of Apple's co-founder based on extensive interviews.

title: The Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
description: Insights on wealth, greed, and happiness through behavioral finance.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert Kiyosaki
description: Personal finance lessons contrasting two mindsets about money.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and hacker investigate a decades-old disappearance.

title: Percy Jackson and the Lightning Thief
author: Rick Riordan
description: A boy discovers he is the son of a Greek god and enters a mythological adventure.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist creates life with tragic consequences.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son struggle to survive in a post-apocalyptic world.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: An accessible explanation of cosmology, black holes, and the universe.
